verses.kjv: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
verses.web: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verses.ct: Then the Holy Spirit led Jesus into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

verses.kjv: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.
verses.web: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward.
verses.ct: After fasting for 40 days and 40 nights, he was starving.

verses.kjv: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
verses.web: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”
verses.ct: The tempter approached him and said, "If you are the Son of God, command these stones to turn into bread."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
verses.web: But he answered, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of God’s mouth.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "It is written: 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.'"

verses.kjv: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,
verses.web: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
verses.ct: Then the devil took him to the holy city and stood him on the highest point of the temple.

verses.kjv: And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.web: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will command his angels concerning you,’ and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don’t dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
verses.ct: He said, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. After all, it is written: 'He will command his angels concerning you, and they will carry you in their hands so that you won't even strike your foot against a stone.'"

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "It is also written: 'You shall not test the LORD your God.'"

verses.kjv: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
verses.web: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory.
verses.ct: Next, the devil took him to an incredibly high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

verses.kjv: And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
verses.web: He said to him, “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”
verses.ct: He told Jesus, "I will give you all of this — if you kneel down and worship me."

verses.kjv: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.web: Then Jesus said to him, “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Get away from me, Satan! For it is written: 'You shall worship the LORD your God, and serve him only.'"

verses.kjv: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
verses.web: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.
verses.ct: Then the devil left him, and angels came and took care of him.

verses.kjv: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;
verses.web: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.
verses.ct: When Jesus heard that John had been thrown into prison, he left for Galilee.

verses.kjv: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
verses.web: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.ct: He moved away from Nazareth and settled in Capernaum, a town by the sea in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

verses.kjv: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
verses.web: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: This fulfilled what the prophet Isaiah had spoken:

verses.kjv: The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
verses.web: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,
verses.ct: "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, along the road to the sea, beyond the Jordan — Galilee of the Gentiles —

verses.kjv: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
verses.web: the people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned.”
verses.ct: the people living in darkness have seen a great light. For those sitting in the shadow of death, a light has dawned."

verses.kjv: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.web: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”
verses.ct: From that point on, Jesus began to preach. His message was simple: "Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is near!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
verses.web: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
verses.ct: One day, walking along the shore of the Sea of Galilee, Jesus saw two brothers — Simon, known as Peter, and his brother Andrew — casting a net into the water, since they were fishermen.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
verses.web: He said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”
verses.ct: Jesus called out to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men."

verses.kjv: And they straightway left their nets, and followed him.
verses.web: They immediately left their nets and followed him.
verses.ct: Right away they dropped their nets and followed him.

verses.kjv: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
verses.web: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.
verses.ct: Farther down the shore, he saw two more brothers — James and John, the sons of Zebedee — sitting in a boat with their father, repairing their nets. Jesus called out to them too.

verses.kjv: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.
verses.web: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.
verses.ct: Without hesitation, they left the boat and their father behind and followed him.

verses.kjv: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.
verses.web: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.ct: Jesus traveled throughout all of Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every kind of disease and sickness among the people.

verses.kjv: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.
verses.web: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.
verses.ct: News about him spread across all of Syria. People brought him everyone who was sick — those suffering from all kinds of diseases and chronic pain, those possessed by demons, epileptics, and paralytics — and he healed them all.

verses.kjv: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judaea, and from beyond Jordan.
verses.web: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.
verses.ct: Massive crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from across the Jordan River.
